thread.title: FAA Says Delta Halted U.S. Flights After Automation Failure - Bloomberg
thread.title_full: FAA Says Delta Halted U.S. Flights After Automation Failure - Bloomberg

title: FAA Says Delta Halted U.S. Flights After Automation Failure - Bloomberg
text:
FAA Says Delta Halted U.S. Flights After Automation Failure by International flights aren’t affected, FAA advisory says Delta issue comes just a week after United grounded flights 
Delta Air Lines Inc. has halted domestic U.S. flights because of “automation issues,” according to the Federal Aviation Administration. 
International flights are exempt, the FAA said in a statement on its website. 
Delta’s computer problem comes just a week after United Continental Holdings Inc. had to ground its U.S. flights following a computer failure. That outage lasted about two and a half hours, although it resulted in relatively few cancellations. 
"Our systems are down," the carrier said in a tweet. "The IT department is working to rectify the situation as soon as possible." 
Delta didn’t immediately return a call from Bloomberg seeking comment. Before it's here, it's on the Bloomberg Terminal.
